excerpt: Jon Bernthal will reprise his Marvel TV role as Frank Castle, aka The Punisher, in the upcoming movie 'Spider-Man: Brand New Day' — get the details.
text: Jon Bernthal is about to punish people on the big screen. Bernthal will reprise his Marvel TV role as Frank Castle, aka The Punisher, in Spider-Man: Brand New Day, according to The Hollywood Reporter. Tom Holland returns as the titular web-slinger in his fourth Spider-Man movie, directed by Destin Daniel Cretton (Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings) and set to hit theaters on July 31, 2026. Bernthal debuted as The Punisher in Season 2 of the Netflix series Marvel’s Daredevil and then landed his own Netflix show, The Punisher, which ran for two seasons. He reprised the role earlier this year as well on Disney+’s Daredevil: Born Again. Bernthal is also slated to play The Punisher in a standalone special for Disney+. His other TV roles include The Bear, American Gigolo and The Walking Dead. Along with Holland and Bernthal, the cast of Spider-Man: Brand New Day (which takes place after 2021’s Spider-Man: No Way Home) includes Zendaya (returning as MJ), Jacob Batalon (returning as Ned) and Stranger Things breakout Sadie Sink in an undisclosed role. html:
Jon Bernthal is about to punish people on the big screen.

Bernthal will reprise his Marvel TV role as Frank Castle, aka The Punisher, in Spider-Man: Brand New Day, according to The Hollywood Reporter. Tom Holland returns as the titular web-slinger in his fourth Spider-Man movie, directed by Destin Daniel Cretton (Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings) and set to hit theaters on July 31, 2026.

Bernthal debuted as The Punisher in Season 2 of the Netflix series Marvel’s Daredevil and then landed his own Netflix show, The Punisher, which ran for two seasons. He reprised the role earlier this year as well on Disney+’s Daredevil: Born Again. Bernthal is also slated to play The Punisher in a standalone special for Disney+. His other TV roles include The Bear, American Gigolo and The Walking Dead.

Along with Holland and Bernthal, the cast of Spider-Man: Brand New Day (which takes place after 2021’s Spider-Man: No Way Home) includes Zendaya (returning as MJ), Jacob Batalon (returning as Ned) and Stranger Things breakout Sadie Sink in an undisclosed role.

Are you looking forward to seeing The Punisher shoot ’em up in the new Spider-Man movie? Hit the comments below with your thoughts on the news.
